intro: Othonna senecionea, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has a compact, bushy growth habit and is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value. Othonna senecionea is drought-tolerant and requires minimal maintenance once established.
